prompts:
Use thoughtbox to reason in the following manner --> let's examine the documentation ( @Dockerfile @DOCKER_ARCHITECTURE.md @docker-compose.yml @.dockerignore ) and the Docker-related files to define what we would expect the local Dockerized Thoughtbox to do at this time, then work backwards from there toward the end state that we need to implement, if there is alteration from what we see here. @thoughtbox:thoughtbox://notebook/operations you can create and use notebooks to help you if you would like. \
\
The reasoning algorithm in terms of using the thoughtbox tool goes like this: define that you wish to use 20, or 30, or 40 or however many totalThoughts in your chain of reasoning, work forward to define a bunch of behavioral tests that we would expect to pass (i.e. you, the agent, executes the behavioral test with optional input/validation from me, the user, and everything goes how we'd expect), and then work backward to define the state of the actual codebase that would produce those results; if there is disparity between this and reality, ask me any questions you need to ask to clarify project context, and then I will answer with information that helps you solve the puzzle. So define N thoughts, work from 1 -> N, define those behavioral tests, work backward from N -> 1 again (possibly in a second branch that converges at the end), and define a .md spec that describes the state of the codebase you came to relative to where it differs from the real codebase.
implement the signal handler fix, then match *both* versions to 1.1.0 and default port to 1729 for consistency.
let's build the new version and deploy to Docker.

you'll need to configure yourself in the cc_mcp_config.json file with the new config entry for the server. it will be worthwhile to perform some research on how to do this, and to structure your process with the approach in @src/prompts/contents/interleaved-thinking-content.ts
Try to call it via MCP now
Never mind, we're failing to connect. Can you perform a longer web research process on how to run Dockerized MCP servers locally?
We're still failing to connect after restarting claude code
We're failing to reconnect: I've restarted Claude Code and rebuilt the server in npm, as well as Docker Compose down and up again
